intro: Eleocharis pittieri, commonly known as the narrowleaf spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences called spikelets. Eleocharis pittieri is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
